page.title: 04Housing in north: FINTRY
page.content:
Sited on the Kippen Road just outwith the village is the{Ross Caravan Park, which has 23 residential caravans.
Forming the edge of the village, the 50-house,{Fintry Hills Estate}is the largest concentration of housing and owner occupation. These were built to a density of a third acre per house in the late 60s and 70s.
{Culcreuch House,}now a commercial concern is still a family home.
Further into the village is the{Mill {House,}a vestige of the textile days of the 19th century. Adjacent is the edge of a well laid out{Council Estate described in square{02600684.
